title: Rustdoc does not correctly ignore input inside HTML tags.

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: I am trying to use the KaTeX `html-in-header` autorender workaround to include mathematics in documentation (see, for example, https://docs.rs/rustdoc-katex-demo/latest/rustdoc_katex_demo/). However, KaTeX auto-render postprocessing is severely incompatible with markdown due to markdown processing almost any underscores it encounters as italics. For example, the documentation ```rust /// For an operator $A$ this is an operator $A_*$ such that its adjoint $(A_*)^*=A$. ``` gets converted into the HTML ```html For an operator $A$ this is an operator $A_$ such that its adjoint $(A_)^*=A$. ``` The standard workaround (unreadable-as-text, and will also stop `README.md` sharing with a modern markdown processor that directly supports KaTeX) would be to to write instead ```rust /// For an operator $A$ this is an operator $A_*$ such that its adjoint $(A_*)^*=A$ ``` because markdown *should not* process things between HTML tags. This does not work with rustdoc: ```html For an operator $A$ this is an operator $A_$ such that its adjoint $(A_)^*=A$. ``` So it seems rustdoc is incorrectly processing input between HTML tags, that standard markdown would ignore. This is on nightly. Issue related to : https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/17390, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/16300, and several others begging some form of LaTeX math support.
